triple.notes:
Some typical HTML errors appear, such as img elements without an alt attribute, and URL attributes that may get non-URL strings.
The ANY-declared systemresponse element forces the validator to report that an html is maybe being nested inside a div element. This could be solved by using a more precise input schema (maybe avoiding ANY completely), breaking the cycle back to the root element.
